revised_title: Advances in Combustion-Fired Magnetohydrodynamic Power Generation
tldr: This article discusses recent advancements in combustion-fired magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) power generation. It focuses on the development of MHD generators, including the Hall configuration, and the use of superconducting field coils for commercial MHD power generation. The article also highlights the potential of MHD generators to produce large amounts of power in a single unit, using rocket engines as a heat source.
